business.headline: 50% or 75%? How much US tariff could India face after Iran moveAt the heart of the nervousness is a proposed 25% US tariff on countries that continue commercial dealings with Iran. While 25% on its own may not sound alarming, markets fear this levy could be added on top of existing duties, pushing the effective tariff burden to 75%.

EPS pensioners can now get digital life certificates at home for free: Here's howThe move is aimed at making life easier for elderly pensioners and those who find it difficult to visit banks, EPFO offices or use smartphones for the annual life certificate process.

Budget 2026: Can GST simplification and better logistics revive retail consumption?As Budget 2026 draws nearer, industry players believe that GST simplification and stronger logistics could play a big role in reviving consumer demand across cities and smaller towns.
Sensex closes 250 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; Trent down 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.48 points to close at 83,627.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.95 points to end at 25,732.30.

India's basmati exporters worry as political turmoil grips IranFor many years, Iran was among India's most important markets for agricultural products, especially basmati rice. However, protests against the country's leadership and growing external pressure have unsettled trade flows.

Blinkit drops 10-minute delivery branding as Centre steps in after gig strikeThis move comes weeks after delivery workers across platforms staged strikes in late December, raising issues around working conditions, delivery pressure and lack of social security.

Budget 2026: What do startups expect from the next policy push?Budget 2026 is approaching and so are the expectations of the startup sector, which is looking for deeper reforms and long-term policy support.

Housing demand in India cools: What it means for homebuyersAccording to the latest PropIndex report by Magicbricks, housing demand in major cities fell by nearly 9% during the October–December 2025 quarter, while the supply of homes available for sale increased by over 3% in the same period.

Sensex ends 250 points lower: Why stock market fell today?The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.48 points to close at 83,627.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.95 points to end at 25,732.30. Losses were broad-based, reflecting cautious positioning amid global uncertainty and domestic technical resistance.

BCCL IPO closes soon: What does GMP tell about expected listing gain?Incorporated in 1972, Bharat Coking Coal Limited is engaged in the production of coking coal, non-coking coal, and washed coal. The company is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Coal India Limited.

Budget 2026: NBFCs call for liquidity support, faster recovery and tax reliefExpectations are rising in the NBFC sector ahead of Budget 2026. Industry leaders are calling for policy measures such as better liquidity access, faster recovery norms and tax relief to sustain lending momentum.

Eternal share price jumps 4% today: What's driving the rally?The stock jumped around 4% in early trade, and by midday was trading at approximately Rs 292.20, up 2.44%, as sentiment strengthened around the company's growth prospects.

Will Budget 2026 prioritise personal income tax cuts?As Budget 2026 approaches, expectations are rising around personal income tax relief. With consumption slowing and middle-class pressure growing, the key question is whether the government will ease tax burdens or stay fiscally cautious.

Vande Bharat Sleeper train is welcome, but let's have more Amrit Bharats Expresses, tooAs Vande Bharat trains redefine speed and comfort, the troubling question persists whether India's rail modernisation truly serves the majority who still travel daily in overcrowded general coaches without dignity.

How smaller cities are driving India's forex and overseas travel demandWhat was once a metro-led trend is now spreading deep into non-metro India. Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities are fuelling a sharp rise in overseas travel and foreign currency spending.

Amagi Media Labs IPO review: Should you subscribe? Check price band, GMPAmagi Media Labs IPO: The IPO includes a fresh issue of 2.26 crore shares, raising Rs 816.00 crore, along with an offer for sale of 2.69 crore shares worth Rs 972.62 crore.
Sensex opens over 250 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; Eternal up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 90.05 points to 83,788.12, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 37.50 points to 25,752.75 as of 10:12 am.

Gold rally is not stopping soon. But is buying at record levels a good idea?On Tuesday, gold prices eased slightly after hitting a new lifetime high a day earlier. Spot gold slipped 0.4% to $4,576.79 per ounce at around 07:04 AM.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO closes today: Should investors bid for BCCL on last day?Bharat Coking Coal IPO opened for subscription on January 9, 2026, and will close today, January 13, 2026. The allotment is expected to be finalised on January 14, 2026.

Alphabet crosses $4 trillion market cap as AI push boosts investor sentimentThe milestones mark a remarkable change in investor sentiment for Alphabet, with its stock surging about 65% in 2025, outperforming its peers on Wall Street's elite group of stocks, the so-called Magnificent Seven.

entertainment.headline: Avengers Doomsday new teaser: Wakandans team up with the Fantastic Four The new teaser of 'Avenger: Doomsday' shows the 'Fantastic Four' and 'Black Panther' crossover. The film is directed by Russo Brothers.

Nidhhi Agerwal, Riddhi Kumar on Hyderabad mobbing: Very unfortunate incident While Nidhhi Agerwal says such mobbing is extremely serious, her co-star in The Raja Saab, Riddhi Kumar, points out that security matters.

Vir Das calls Gen Z a self-aware tribe; shares Aamir Khan's reaction to Happy Patel Vir Das shared insights about his upcoming film 'Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos', revealing producer Aamir Khan's reaction to the story. Speaking to India Today, he also expressed his views on India's Gen Z and their ability to gather around undeniable truths and societal causes.

Malaika Arora on Arjun Kapoor's importance in her life, new link-up rumours Malaika Arora reflected on how her relationships, including with Arjun Kapoor, have remained in the public spotlight following her divorce from Arbaaz Khan. She addressed the constant scrutiny around her relationships with men.

As Toxic stirs debate, Yash's past interview makes a viral comeback The teaser for Yash's upcoming film Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups has led to a complaint by the Aam Aadmi Party with the Karnataka State Commission for Women over alleged obscene content, reigniting debate as old comments by Yash resurface online.

Karan Aujla's wife Palak shuts down cheating rumours about him with romantic post Karan Aujla's wife, Palak, shut down viral cheating rumours involving a United States based artist by sharing a photo with her husband on social media. Featuring the singer's track "Winning Speech," she highlighted lyrics about loyalty, sending a subtle but clear message of unity to fans.

Netflix sets streaming date for Korean mystery thriller The Art of Sarah Netflix has confirmed that the original South Korean crime thriller The Art of Sarah, starring Shin Hye Sun, will debut worldwide on 13 February 2026. Filming for the eight-episode series concluded in May 2025, with a teaser trailer now available.

Happy Patel Khatarnak Jasoos: Vir Das reveals Aamir Khan's hatke feedback Vir Das, in an interview with India Today, spoke about his upcoming film 'Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos'. The film has been produced by Aamir Khan.

Space Gen: Chandrayaan trailer revisits failure before India's moon mission success The series Space Gen: Chandrayaan, inspired by India's space missions, explores the aftermath of the Chandrayaan-2 lunar landing failure, focusing on the challenges faced by ISRO and the journey towards achieving a historic milestone.

Vijay's Theri re-release postponed amid Jana Nayagan censor setback Vijay's film Theri, which was scheduled to re-release in theatres on January 14, has now been postponed. The development came as Vijay faces a court battle for the release of his film Jana Nayagan.

Khosla Ka Ghosla 2: Anupam Kher reunites with OG cast as film goes on floors Actor Anupam Kher has sparked renewed interest in the sequel to the 2006 film Khosla Ka Ghosla by posting photos with original cast members and expressing anticipation for the project.

Splitsvilla 16's Afghan contestant Sadhaaf a Shiv devotee, added Shankar to her name Sadhaaf Shankar, a contestant on the Indian reality show, 'Splitsvilla 16', surprised host Karan Kundrra as she revealed that she adopted her surname out of devotion to Lord Shiva. Residing in India for a decade, she expressed her strong desire to get married to an Indian.

Amma challenged me: Mallika Prasad on her villainous act in Mardaani 3 The trailer for Mardaani 3 has generated significant attention, with audiences responding strongly to Mallika Prasad's portrayal of the antagonist Amma.

Disha Patani, Talwiinder hold hands in viral clip, internet asks are they dating A video from Nupur Sanon's wedding in Udaipur has gone viral, showing Disha Patani holding hands with Punjabi singer Talwiinder, leading to widespread speculation about their relationship status.

Best outdoor shoot of my life: Sharmila Tagore recalls Aranyer Din Ratri in Palamu Sharmila Tagore revisited the making of Satyajit Ray's Aranyer Din Ratri during its 4K screening in Delhi. She highlighted the film's lasting relevance and the tough conditions of the shoot that shaped its unique character.

Parasakthi director blasts Vijay fans: We're fighting against their rowdyism, goonism Parasakthi director Sudha Kongara Prasad criticised rowdy behaviour by Vijay fans allegedly targeting her film. The controversy highlighted challenges filmmakers face from aggressive fan bases amid film releases.

Bhartha Mahasayulaku Wignapthi review: Better than previous films, if that's the barRelease Date:Tue Jan 13, 2026 Bhartha Mahasayulaku Wignapthi movie review: Bhartha Mahasayulaku Wignapthi, a Sankranthi comedy starring Ravi Teja, Ashika Ranganath and Dimple Hayathi, was meant to signal a comeback. Instead, it settles for familiar gags and uneven laughs.

Jana Nayagan censor row: Top Tamil producer calls legal battle flabbergasting National Award-winning author and producer G Dhananjayan has weighed in on the legal dispute between the makers of Jana Nayagan and the Central Board of Film Certification, calling the situation unprecedented and urging for a resolution to benefit the film industry.

Who is Beatriz Taufenbach, actor with Yash in viral Toxic scene causing uproar? Actor Beatriz Taufenbach has become a central subject of conversation following her brief appearance alongside Yash in the teaser for Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups. The intimate scene featured in the teaser has drawn significant attention online.

general news.headline: Keep protesting, help on its way: Trump's message to Iranians as toll rises to 2,000With the death toll surpassing 2,000 in Iran, Donald Trump described the protesters as "patriots" and urged them to take control of the institutions in a Truth Social post.

Multiple drones sighted in J&K's Rajouri hours after Army Chief's warning to PakThe incident came hours after Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi warned Pakistan against UAV intrusions, saying India had conveyed that such activity was not acceptable.

Trump's 25% tariffs on Iran trade will have minimal impact on India: CentreIran's major import partners include the UAE at $21 billion (30 per cent), China at $17 billion (26 per cent), Turkiye at $11 billion (16 per cent) and the European Union at $6 billion (9 per cent), underscoring India's relatively marginal share.

Pak-China pact illegal: Army Chief rejects Beijing's claim on Shaksgam valleyArmy Chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi said India has never recognised the so-called agreement under which Pakistan ceded territory to China.

Revenge of the Desert: How Mahmud Ghazni nearly fell after the Somnath plunderThis article is the first installment in our series, exploring how the powerful empire built by Mahmud Ghazni in Central Asia sowed the seeds of its own destruction.

X down for thousands of users globally, netizens report errors loading postsSocial media platform X suffered a widespread outage on Tuesday, with tens of thousands of users in the US, UK and Canada reporting access issues, according to Downdetector.

Shoot-at-sight for forest-grabbers like leopards? Uddhav's roar before BMC polls"To control the menace caused by leopards, Forest Minister Ganesh Naik recently ordered 'shoot at sight'. But what about those who are grabbing forest land? Will he also order 'shoot at sight' for such industrialists who are intruding into forests?" Uddhav asked as campaigning for the Mumbai civic polls drew to a close.

TCS to keep firing employees if needed, in 6 months has let go of 30,000In 2025, TCS was one of the big tech giants that restructured teams, reportedly due to AI. Now, the company says, if needed, firings will continue in 2026. In the last 6 months, TCS has let go of around 30,000 employees.

After kill switch, Iran raids homes to seize Starlink devicesAfter using Chinese or Russian military-grade jammers to disrupt Starlink, the Khamenei regime is now raiding homes to seize communication equipment to hide the mass killings in Iran. The government and its loyalists are communicating through a protected "whitelist" network as they brutally supress the protests.
Chilly morning expected on Makar Sankranti, cold wave and fog to lingerTraditionally, Makar Sankranti is believed to mark the end of peak winter, coinciding with the Sun's northward movement.

MI vs GG Live Score: MI (57/2 in 7 ov), Amanjot, Harman steady MI in chaseMumbai Indians Women (MI) vs Gujarat Giants Women (GG) Live Score: Mumbai Indians have lost two quick wickets in the Powerplay after Bharti Fulmali launched a blistering assault, smashing 36 off just 15 balls to provide a stunning finish. At one stage, Gujarat looked set to labour their way to 180, but the late onslaught powered them past the 190 mark at the Dy Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

US on Iran protester's execution: First to be sentenced to death, won't be the lastThe US State Department said more than 10,600 Iranians have been arrested solely for participating in protests against the regime. Among them is 26-year-old Erfan Soltani, who has been sentenced to death, with the execution scheduled for January 14.

What is the India-China dispute over Shaksgam Valley in Kashmir?The sharp exchange between India and China over Kashmir's Shaksgam Valley has brought into renewed focus the strategically vital area that New Delhi maintains was illegally ceded by Pakistan to China in 1963.

US cancelled 1 lakh visas in 2025. Who's in the line of fire?Following Donald Trump's return to office as President, the US government has revoked a record 100,000 visas in one year, including over 10,000 student and worker visas. This comes as the US is in the midst of a massive crackdown on immigration characterised by deportations and new visa restrictions.

Lone Spanish satellite survives PSLV-C62's failure, sends data from spaceThe 25-kg football-sized prototype, launched as a co-passenger on January 12, separated "against all odds" from the rocket's fourth stage.

Blinkit drops its 10-minute tag. Here's why it won't change lives, including yoursWe have all heard it, Blinkit is dropping its 10-minute delivery branding. Here we will tell you why the move won't change lives, including that of the gig workers. Though it might work to bring down the expectations of customers, it won't change how quick commerce really works.

Australia tightens student visa scrutiny, India moved to highest risk categoryAustralia has moved India to the highest student visa risk category under revised Assessment Levels effective January 8, 2026. The sudden change raises documentation requirements and scrutiny for Indian applicants, unsettling universities and agents and sparking concerns over predictability, processing delays and Australia's appeal as a study destination.

US to invite India to join Pax Silica. Gamechanger alliance explained in 5 pointsUS Ambassador Sergio Gor said India would be invited to join Pax Silica, an alliance that seeks to set up an entire ecosystem for AI technology, starting from refining to manufacturing hi-tech components. Here we explain to you the meaning of Pax Silica, and its significance for India and other partners.

CBI summons Vijay again on Jan 19 in Karur stampede case, he cites PongalThe superstar requested a fresh date for further questioning, citing Pongal, and will be summoned again as the probe continues under Supreme Court supervision.

India Open pigeon free: Badminton body rebuffs Danish shuttler's hygiene complaintIndia Open 2026: Badminton Association of India general secretary Sanjay Mishra clarified that hygiene complaints were about the training hall, not the main arena, after Denmark's Mia Blichfeldt flagged unhealthy warm-up conditions at the India Open on Tuesday.

What happens to 16 satellites PSLV lost in space? Ex-Isro engineer explainsTrouble struck near the end of the third stage, a solid-fuel motor that provides the final big push toward orbit. ISRO reported a sudden disturbance.

Chennai sanitation worker finds gold worth Rs 45 lakh lying on road, returns itPadma, a sanitation worker from T Nagar, Chennai, received official recognition after returning 45 sovereigns of gold jewellery she found on the roadside to the police.

Techie accused of using casteist slurs against wife caught while he was with loverThe woman accused her husband of verbally abusing her using caste slurs and subjecting her to repeated physical assaults.

Army Chief reveals how 'certain' Op Sindoor orders got Pak to plead for peaceArmy Chief General Upendra Dwivedi revealed that a set of "certain orders" issued on May 10 last year proved to be a key turning point that pushed Pakistan, which suffered huge losses, to reach out for a ceasefire during Operation Sindoor.

sports.headline: Arbeloa reveals Alonso wished him well after he became Real Madrid's new manager Álvaro Arbeloa said Xabi Alonso reached out to wish him well after his appointment as Real Madrid manager, underlining that their friendship remains strong despite their new roles.

Who is Ayushi Soni? Gujarat Giants batter becomes first to be retired out in WPL Ayushi Soni made WPL history by becoming the first batter to be retired out, a tactical move that helped Gujarat Giants post 192 against Mumbai Indians in Women's Premier League 2026.

IND vs NZ, 2nd ODI: Predicted XI: Will Gautam Gambhir hand Ayush Badoni ODI debut? IND vs NZ, 2nd ODI: Ayush Badoni could make his debut in the Rajkot ODI, after batting coach Sitanshu Kotak explained that India included her to provide an additional bowling option alongside their existing five bowlers.

No communication breakdown between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli: Batting coach IND vs NZ: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak has dismissed rumours of a communication breakdown between senior batters Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma and head coach Gautam Gambhir, insisting the team remains fully focused on its World Cup preparations.

India Open pigeon free: Badminton body rebuffs Danish shuttler's hygiene complaint India Open 2026: Badminton Association of India general secretary Sanjay Mishra clarified that hygiene complaints were about the training hall, not the main arena, after Denmark's Mia Blichfeldt flagged unhealthy warm-up conditions at the India Open on Tuesday.

England do not have a drinking problem: Broad dismisses Ashes tour criticism Former England seamer Stuart Broad has insisted that the current England team do not have a drinking problem, despite a series of alcohol-related incidents over the winter in the Ashes.

India coach backs Ayush Badoni's ODI selection: No team goes in with five bowlers India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said Ayush Badoni was picked for the remaining ODIs to add bowling depth after Washington Sundar's injury, stressing India cannot risk playing with a five-bowler attack.

Lakshya Sen weaponises familiarity to spoil Ayush Shetty's India Open debut Young Indian shuttler Ayush Shetty endured a forgettable outing at the India Open Super 750 as he bowed out in the opening round against former champion and training partner Lakshya Sen.

Ayush Badoni-less Delhi knocked out as Vidarbha reaches semis Vidarbha booked their place in the Vijay Hazare Trophy semi-finals for the second consecutive season with a 76-run victory over a depleted Delhi side. Delhi's campaign ended at the quarter-final stage as they struggled in the absence of Ayush Badoni, who was on national duty, and the injured skipper Rishabh Pant.

MI vs GG Live Score: MI (37/2 in 5 ov), MI lose two quick wickets Mumbai Indians Women (MI) vs Gujarat Giants Women (GG) Live Score: Mumbai Indians have lost two quick wickets in the Powerplay after Bharti Fulmali launched a blistering assault, smashing 36 off just 15 balls to provide a stunning finish. At one stage, Gujarat looked set to labour their way to 180, but the late onslaught powered them past the 190 mark at the Dy Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Punjab storm into semifinals with comprehensive win over MP Punjab stormed into the semifinals of the Vijay Hazare Trophy with a commanding all-round display, thrashing Madhya Pradesh by 183 runs. The top order laid a solid foundation with the bat before the bowlers completed a clinical rout to seal Punjab's place in the last four.

Denmark shuttler unhappy with conditions, cleanliness in DelhiIndia Open 2026: Denmark's Mia Blichfeldt criticised playing conditions at IG Stadium, saying the venue change has done little to improve what she called unhealthy and unprofessional surroundings, and urged the BWF to step in ahead of the World Championships.

Proud Mitchell Starc reacts as Alyssa Healy announces Australia retirementMitchell Starc expressed pride as Alyssa Healy announced her retirement, closing the curtain on a trophy-laden Australia career. Healy will retire after Australia's home series against India.

Manchester United agree deal with Carrick to take charge until end of seasonManchester United have agreed a deal in principle with former midfielder Michael Carrick to join the club as their interim manager until the end of the 2025-26 season.

Joburg Super Kings captain Faf du Plessis ruled out of SA20 due to injuryFaf du Plessis, captain of the Joburg Super Kings, has been ruled out of the rest of the SA20 season following a thumb injury sustained during the match against MI Cape Town on January 10.

Gujarat Giants look to extend winning streak against old foes Mumbai IndiansGujarat Giants look to continue their winning streak against Mumbai Indians in WPL 2026. The match promises a thrilling contest with Mumbai's perfect record against Gujarat at stake.

T20 World Cup: Bangladesh reiterates it won't play in India in latest meeting with ICCBangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has reiterated that it won't play in India for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 in the latest meeting with the International Cricket Council (ICC). The ICC held a special meeting with the BCB to discuss the matter amid growing tensions between the BCB and the BCCI.

Watch: Sachin Tendulkar vs Amitabh Bachchan in hand-cricket battle, here's who wonSachin Tendulkar and Amitabh Bachchan shared a fun game of hand cricket during the ISPL event. The light-hearted exchange between the two legends quickly went viral and delighted fans online.

Shreyas Iyer is India's Mr Consistent: R Ashwin impressed with batter's ODI returnR Ashwin hailed Shreyas Iyer as India's Mr Consistent in ODI cricket. Returning from injury in Vadodara, Iyer impressed immediately with a fluent 49, showing composure and timing in a pressure chase.

Sundar shouldn't have batted in 1st ODI, it was a wrong call: Former batterMohammad Kaif has criticised Indian team management for allowing injured Washington Sundar to bat in the first ODI against New Zealand. The decision risked Sundar's fitness ahead of the crucial T20 World Cup 2026.

At 37, Ishant Sharma returns to captaincy, completes 200 List A wicketsVijay Hazare Trophy: Ishant Sharma returned to captain Delhi after seven years and reached 200 List A wickets. The 37-year-old pacer has been miserly in the ongoing domestic 50-over tournament.

Virat Kohli hasn't changed: R Ashwin's interesting take about regal ODI formIndia vs New Zealand: Former India spinner R Ashwin reflected on Virat Kohli's sensational ODI form, saying the former captain is in the right mental space and enjoying his cricket more than ever.

How Xabi Alonso's Real Madrid exit was more than an El Clasico lossXabi Alonso's Real Madrid stint ended far earlier than expected despite early promise. From dressing room tensions to fading results, a slow build-up of issues finally cost the former Leverkusen coach his dream job.

Shreyas Iyer on verge of surpassing Virat Kohli, Shikhar Dhawan's major recordShreyas Iyer is on the verge of leaving behind Shikhar Dhawan and Virat Kohli to become the fastest Indian to 3,000 runs in ODIs. The star batter is just 34 runs away from achieving the milestone.

FC Barcelona announce Joao Cancelo return on loan deal from Al HilalFC Barcelona have reinforced their backline by re-signing Joao Cancelo on loan from Al Hilal. The move comes a day after Barca lifted their first trophy of the season by beating Real Madrid.

Asif Nazrul: 'Impossible For Bangladesh To Play In India', Cites 'Anti-Bangladesh Campaign'Bangladesh's Youth and Sports Adviser, Asif Nazrul, has stated that India is unsafe for his country's cricketers, creating uncertainty around Bangladesh's participation in the upcoming T20 World Cup matches hosted in India. Nazrul claims 'it is impossible for Bangladesh to play in India' due to an ongoing 'anti-Bangladesh campaign' and a lack of security. He is demanding a neutral venue, such as Sri Lanka, for his team's matches. The adviser also questioned the neutrality of the International Cricket Council (ICC), suggesting it may be influenced by India. The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has indicated it is awaiting a final decision from the ICC on the matter, with a travel deadline for the team approaching on January 26.

Virat Kohli's brother takes cryptic dig on Sanjay Manjrekar for easy ODIs commentIND vs NZ: Virat Kohli's Vadodara masterclass reignited the ODI difficulty debate. His brother Vikas Kohli took a subtle dig at Sanjay Manjrekar after the former India batter's easy format remarks resurfaced online.

Kohli's young doppleganger recalls being called 'chhota cheeku' by India starVirat Kohli affectionately nicknamed his viral young fan 'chhota cheeku' ahead of the first ODI against New Zealand in Vadodara. The child went viral for having uncanny resemblance to Kohli's childhood photographs.

Gautam Gambhir biased? Did Ayush Badoni deserve India ODI call-upAyush Badoni earned his maiden call-up to Team India for the remaining ODIs against New Zealand. The selection has sparked criticism of head coach Gautam Gambhir, with accusations of favouritism from fans.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
